page.title: 02LIFE STYLES
page.content: One well-known local character is 88 year old Nellie Copland who still works her 20 acre croft at Woodend, Cushnie. Details are:- 3 acres of hay,3 of turnips,6 of oats, all for feeding her livestock which are 8 yearling stirks,6 cows,6 calves,7 cats and hens.She works from 7 a.m. till dark.One of few who still cuts oats traditionally in stooks.Her machinery includes a petrol-driven threshing mill. She remembers when she took her crops to Ladymill in Muir of Fowlis She also recalls the wheelwright, tailor, agricultural joiner,shoemaker and blacksmith.She walks everywhere and has never travelled farther than Aberdeen and that was many years ago. Her home has no electricity,she cooks on open peat, coal and wood burning fire and W.C.is outdoors. Television is worked from a car battery.
